hanzi-su-wiki:
拐

Значения

Похищать

Мнемоника

Квадрат — сустав, ниже — нож 刀 в значении «расчленять суставы, отдельный». В целом — выкручивать 扌 руки, захватывать, похищать.

Варианты

枴
purpleculture_pinyin:
guǎi
to turn (a corner etc); to kidnap; to swindle; to misappropriate; walking stick; crutch; seven (used as a substitute for 七 )
повернуть (угол и т. д.); похитить; мошенничать; присвоить; трость; костыль; семь (используется вместо 七)

purpleculture_examples:
拐杖 [ guǎi zhàng ]: crutches; crutch; walking stick
拐卖 [ guǎi mài ]: human trafficking; to abduct and sell; to kidnap and sell
拐弯 [ guǎi wān ]: to go round a curve; to turn a corner; fig. a new direction
拐骗 [ guǎi piàn ]: swindle; abduct
拐角 [ guǎi jiǎo ]: to turn a corner; corner

heisig_chinese_memo: You point your finger at your friend and call him a muscle mouth for talking too much. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: kidnap, finger, fingers, mouth, sword, dagger
koohiiStory1: Wrap your FINGERS around someone´s MOUTH to keep them quiet, then put the KNIFE to their throat to ensure their cooperation. This is the best way to KIDNAP someone.
koohiiStory2: After you beckon (#650) someone by seducing them, you kidnap them and hang them upside down (the reversed positions of seduce).
jp_example_words: 拐う(さらう): to carry off, to run away with, to kidnap, to abduct
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A mouth with a sword is threatening to cut off your fingers because they've kidnapped you! You can't see anything about them, since they're all covered up. All you see is their angry mouth and the sword they keep putting near your fingers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine you've been kidnapped. And the person who kidnapped you is going to cut off some of your fingers and mail them to your parents if they don't pay the ransom soon enough. You don't want your fingers to be cut off with a sword! Help!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You've been kidnapped and your kidnapper has asked for one thing in exchange for your safe return: a kayak (かい). Kayaks are expensive. And it's way easier for this dude to kidnap you and demand your family buy one and give it to them than for them to work for one.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If your parents don't send in the kayak to your kidnapper soon, you're gonna lose some fingers. Come on guys, just get the kayak already!!!

guǎi: (глаг) похищать; обманывать, выманивать
guǎi: (глаг) хромать, быть хромым
Kanshudo_mnemonic: with your sword under your mouth (叧) you use your hand (扌) to kidnap
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You point your finger at your friend and call him a muscle mouth for talking too much. &nbsp Then he turns your finger back around so it's pointing at you and calls you the muscle mouth. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand " to the sound of "叧", the original meaning is crutches. "Guangyun‧Xiyun": "Crutch, the things of hands and feet." "Longkan Handbook‧Hand": "Crutch, vulgar; being a crutch. The old man can also stick." "New History of the Five Dynasties-Han Gaozu Ji" : "Give me a wooden crutch."

" Abduction " can mean limp. "Journey to the West" Chapter 1: "The Monkey King jumped up and walked twice with crutches."

Defrauding people or property can be called abduction . "Qing Ping Shan Tang's Script-Misrecognizing the Corpse": "Said Xiaoer is on the run with the crutches and is missing."

" Abduction " may also represent a turn. "Lao Can's Travels" Chapter 3: "Entering the gate and looking west, there are three living rooms, which are also properly laid out."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " to the sound of "叧", the original meaning is crutches.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「叧」聲，本義為拐杖。《廣韻‧蟹韻》：「拐，手腳之物枝也。」《龍龕手鑑‧手部》：「拐，俗；正作柺。老人杖也。」《新五代史‧漢高祖紀》：「賜以木拐一。」

　　「拐」可表示跛行。《西游記》第1回：「猴王縱身跳起，拐呀拐的走了兩遍。」

　　把人或財物騙走可稱為「拐」。 《清平山堂話本‧錯認尸》：「告小二拐物在逃，不知去向。」

　　「拐」也可表示轉彎。《老殘游記》第3回：「進了大門，望西一拐，便是三間客廳，鋪設也還妥當。」

從「 手 」，「 叧 」聲，本義為拐杖。《廣韻‧蟹韻》：「拐，手腳之物枝也。」《龍龕手鑑‧手部》：「拐，俗；正作柺。老人杖也。」《新五代史‧漢高祖紀》：「賜以木拐一。」 「 拐 」可表示跛行。《西游記》第1回：「猴王縱身跳起，拐呀拐的走了兩遍。」 把人或財物騙走可稱為「 拐 」。 《清平山堂話本‧錯認尸》：「告小二拐物在逃，不知去向。」 「 拐 」也可表示轉彎。《老殘游記》第3回：「進了大門，望西一拐，便是三間客廳，鋪設也還妥當。」
From the " hand" to the sound of " 叧", the original meaning is crutches. "Guangyun‧Xiyun": "Crutch, the things of hands and feet." "Longkan Handbook‧Hand": "Crutch, vulgar; being a crutch. The old man can also stick." "New History of the Five Dynasties-Han Gaozu Ji" : "Give me a wooden crutch." " Abduction" can mean limp. "Journey to the West" Chapter 1: "The Monkey King jumped up and walked twice with crutches." Defrauding people or property can be called abduction. "Qing Ping Shan Tang's Script-Misrecognizing the Corpse": "Said Xiaoer is on the run with the crutches and is missing." " Abduction" may also represent a turn. 拐字的基本解释

拐
guǎi
转折：拐弯。
骗：拐骗。拐卖。
走路不稳，跛：他走路一拐一拐的。
走路时帮助支持身体的棍：拐棍。双拐。

拐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［guǎi］
［《廣韻》求蟹切，上蟹，羣。］
亦作“1”。
(1)拐扙。
(2)瘸，跛行。
(3)拐骗。
(4)转弯；转过。
(5)弯曲处；角。
(6)指需要拐弯的动作。
(7)歪；乖僻。
(8)臂膊。参见“拐肘”。
(9)方言。用臂肘碰。
(10)量词。

拐字的英文翻译

◎ 拐
abduct, crutch, kidnap, limp, swindle, turn

拐字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　拐； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页425第10
【唐韻】求蟹切，音箉。手腳物枝也。　又【正字通】古買切，乖上聲。俗謂拐騙。

拐字的源字形

拐字的起名意思

拐杖。通“枴”。转折。诱骗。

Abduct
Basic explanation of words
Abduct
guǎi
Turning: turning.
Deception: kidnapping. Trafficking.
Unsteady walking, lame: He walked with crutches.
A stick that helps support the body when walking: crutches. Crutches.
Abduct
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［guǎi］
["Guangyun" asks for crab cuts, crabs, group. ]
Also called "1".
(1) Abduction.
(2) Lame, lame.
(3) Abduction.
(4) Turn; turn.
(5) Bend; angle.
(6) Refers to actions that require turning.
(7) Crooked; perverse.
(8) Arms. See "elbow".
(9) Dialects. Touch with your elbow.
(10) Quantifiers.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　guai; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 425 No. 10
[Tang Yun] Seeking to cut crabs, sound. The hands and feet are also branches.　[Zhengzitong] Ancient Maiqie, sounded obediently. It is commonly referred to as abduction.

Source glyph
Abduct
Name meaning
crutch. Linked with "abduction". Turning point. Deceive.
拐
形声字。t(手)表意,表示手持扮杖;另(丹gud)表声,丹通刚,表示拐杖是腿脚伤残者走路时所要依靠的。本义是拐
杖。
①走路时挂的棍子:~棍|~杖。2年转向:~角|~弯。③
破;瘸:一脚|一瘸→~。④骗:~骗|~卖|诱~。
一脖 ~带 ~逃 ~肘 ~子 ~弯抹角 孤~
guăi
拐拐
Похищать
Пиктофонетические символы.
T (рука) означает, что вы держите в руке палку; другая (дан гуд) выражает звук, Дэн Тонганг, что означает, что люди с ограниченными возможностями ног и ступней используют костыли для ходьбы.
①Палки, болтающиеся при ходьбе: ~ палки | ~ палки.
2 года рулевого управления: ~ Угол | ~ Изгиб.
③Сломанный; хромой: нога | хромота → ~.
④Cheat: ~ Чит | ~ продавать | побуждает ~.
Шея ~ пояс ~ побег ~ локоть ~ сын ~ кривые углы ~
гуай
Похищение
guǎi
I гл.
1) обмануть, смошенничать, выманить хитростью; похитить, соблазнить
拐孩子 заманить (похитить) ребёнка
拐款潜逃 выманить деньги и сбежать
2) повернуть, завернуть (напр. за угол)
那人拐进胡同里去了 этот человек свернул в переулок
拐一个弯就到了 поверни за угол и дойдёшь; разыщешь тут же за углом
3) повредить, нанести ущерб (по неосторожности)
用胳膊肘拐了他一下 локтем нечаянно задеть его
车拐伤了人 машина сбила человека
不留神把茶碗拐到地下了 по неосторожности сбросить чашку на пол
4) хромать, прихрамывать, ковылять
他走道直拐啦 он идёт ковыляя
一拐一拐地走路 идти прихрамывая (ковыляя)
走拐了腿 захромать от долгой ходьбы
II сущ.
1) поворот: виток
…七十二拐后 после семьдесят второго витка...
2) (см. также 拐) палка, трость, посох; костыль
这个伤员能扶着拐慢慢走路了 этот раненый может потихоньку идти, опираясь на палку (костыль)
3) цифра семь (в радиообмене)
III прил.
1) изогнутый, неровный
墙拐 эта стена неровная
门拐 дверь неровная
2) диал. guāi дурной (о характере)
Radicals: 扌, 口, 刀  (fingers, mouth, sword)
Meaning Mnemonic
A mouth with a sword is threatening to cut off your fingers because they've kidnapped you! You can't see anything about them, since they're all covered up. All you see is their angry mouth and the sword they keep putting near your fingers.
Imagine you've been kidnapped. And the person who kidnapped you is going to cut off some of your fingers and mail them to your parents if they don't pay the ransom soon enough. You don't want your fingers to be cut off with a sword! Help!
Reading Mnemonic
You've been kidnapped and your kidnapper has asked for one thing in exchange for your safe return: a kayak (かい). Kayaks are expensive. And it's way easier for this dude to kidnap you and demand your family buy one and give it to them than for them to work for one.
If your parents don't send in the kayak to your kidnapper soon, you're gonna lose some fingers. Come on guys, just get the kayak already!!!

刀 (катана), 口 (рот), 扎
